results.title: A Child is born
results.brief_description: Traces the relationship between a young wife and her husband from the time that they decide to have children to the birth and homecoming of their first child. Shows the development of the foetus using live photography and the actual birth of the child, capturing the blend of pain and joy in life’s most miraculous moment. Adapted from the film “Barnet (the child)” produced by Skandia Insurance Company, Stockholm. Narrated by Mary S. Caldesone.

results.title: A Child is a child (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dubnoff Center, AIMS Instructional Media, A L Levitt and Molly Gorelick
results.brief_description: Shows children with handicaps integrated with non-handicapped children in the pre-school laboratory at California State University, Northridge. It shows that the trend towards special education for children with handicaps has gone so far that many educators tend to lose sight of the fundamental fact that a child is a child.

results.title: A Child in his country = Un Enfant un pays
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jacques Bobet, Rene Jodoin and Pierre Moretti
results.brief_description: A childhood fantasy where dreams carry a boy far to adventure. It is an animated film in a contemporary style, employing drawn backgrounds, inserts of photographs, and successions of the same pictures to suggest movement. The most animated figure is the boy. He arrives in Canada on an ocean liner and is, in turn, a hunter of polar bear, a cowboy, a hockey star, and a swimmer. (Award: Toronto.)

results.title: A child grows: the first year
results.brief_description: This program focuses on the physiological and psychological landmarks of the first year of life: noting that the order, not the timing is predictable. Using footage of infants to illustrate each point of maturation, areas covered include; motor development; muscle control and strength - from birth; reflex actions - smiling, rolling over, sitting, crawling, walking; hand-eye co-ordination; exploration of world and link to feeding and digestion; sensory development; language and speech development; developmental norms; attachment, separation and anxiety; development of thinking, planning, goal directed actions and; symbolic representations. Informative and useful to both students and parents of newborns.

results.title: A Child's voice
results.creator_credit: B.A.C. Films Ltd (Ireland), Roland Hill and Kieran Hickey
results.brief_description: A tale of suspense. Three nights a week, Ainsley Rupert Macreadie writes and broadcasts chilling and intriguing tales of horror to rapt audiences. But his latest cruel narrative becomes a reality when the character of the boy involved refuses to obey the writer’s commands, and Macreadie discovers that he is the victim of the kind of terror which until now he has reserved for others. Starring T.P. McKenna as Ainsley Rupert Macreadie, June Tobin as the child. Written by David Thomson and narrated by Valentine Dyall. (Awards: First Prize Short Fiction Category - Chicago International Film Festival, 1978; Festival Choice - London Film Festival, 1978) Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.

results.title: A Child's visit to the dentist
results.brief_description: Designed to allay children’s fear of the dentist and all that dentists represent, by following a five-fear-old on her first visit to the dentist. Outlines the function of various people working in the surgery, as well as explaining the purposes of X-ray machines, drills, scrapers, etc.

results.title: A Child's place
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Dick Foster and Eurfron Gwynne Jones
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
Looks at the system of daycare for young children in Israel, USSR, China and Sweden.The film asks “Where are the children? Who are they with? and what are they doing?”.

results.title: A Child's Christmas in Wales by Dylan Thomas
results.brief_description: Using still photographs, this film shows life in Wales, illustrating Dylan Thomas’s recorded reading of his reminiscences about Christmas in his home country. Children play tricks on their elders, the adults enjoy the food and drink and even the local fire brigade becomes involved.
results.title_for_label: A Child’s Christmas in Wales by Dylan Thomas

results.title: A Child
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Illustrates the importance of a teacher’s observation of individual behaviour in the classroom situation. An indecisive child is directed to pursue an activity through one-to-one contact with the teacher.
